snippet: Few golfers from England have won the British Open on their native courses. Luke Donald, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose are faced with that task this week.
abstract: Dave Anderson Sports of The Times column observes that few golfers from England have won the British Open on their native courses; Luke Donald, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose are facing that task this year.
lead_paragraph: Few golfers from England have won the British Open on their native courses. Luke Donald, Lee Westwood and Justin Rose are faced with that task this week.

headline.seo: Home Soil Is No Advantage for English Golfers at Open
headline.main: Home Has Been No Advantage for Englishmen at Open
headline.print_headline: Home Has Been No Advantage for Englishmen at Open
